features: Paring knives are great for a multitude of tasks, from slicing, to shaping delicate decorations
Stainless steel blade won't rust even after multiple uses
Comes with assorted colors, purple, blue, green, and orange
body.description: This Chef Craft Home Cutlery Set of 4 paring knives offers proven durability with multi colored molded handles for ease of clean up. 2.5 inch blade is single bevel precision ground for lasting sharpness, made from stainless steel alloy. These hard to find little kitchen knives are an exceptional tool for fruit and vegetable preparation. Use for road trips, tail gating events, camping, parties. house warming, food service, chefs, college students. Just like the one's in grandma's kitchen drawer.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: 4 Piece Multicolor Paring Knife Set A paring knife is one of the most versatile knives in the kitchen. It can handle any task that is too small, or too delicate for a chef's knife. There are no fancy gadgets needed, with just a small knife and a little practice, you can make the same types of cuts as the pros.

Our Products: Employee Tested, Customer Approved All of our products have been extensively tested in our kitchens to ensure that we are bringing our customers the best value possible. We have run our turners through the dishwasher hundreds of times before marking them dishwasher safe, and have cooked with our silicone utensils for years to verify their durability. Each detail is scrutinized and revamped by both our employees (and their families), so we are confident that we bring you the best possible products.

Our Story Chef Craft was founded in 1985 by Peter Ernster. It was passed down the family through the generations. We have kept the same vision as the beginning: bringing our customers the best value based products that we can. Today, it means shifting towards sourcing products made with more sustainable materials like bamboo and wheat straw.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sharp and easy to use for dicing small vegies.
reviews.reviewText: Very pleased with this product. I have a knife of this size which I got from Pampered Chef several years ago and it broke two weeks ago. The steel of the knife just broke in half. Don't know my own strength obviously. Any way I ordered these knives (4 came in the package) and I used one today. Perfect.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The perfect pairing knife
reviews.reviewText: These lightweight, flexible paring knives are excellent. Just be careful because they are very sharp.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Some of my favorite paring knives for delicate work
reviews.reviewText: These tiny paring knives will not hold an edge forever and they won't last years or even a year maybe under daily use, but they will get razor sharp quickly and will do the job nicely for decorative tomato rose garnishing. They are chisel ground, which I was not expecting, but not a huge deal. It's probably written somewhere in description that I didn't bother reading. They relatively sharp right from the box and it only took me around 10 minutes a knife to hone the edge to my liking.The knives are flexible, light weight, and small. I find them to be fine to hold on to and plenty easy to manipulate and manoeuvre. My biggest complaint is using a bamboo, wood, or any cutting board makes them go dull rather quickly. Also, the thin plastic handles will crack and break easily if you abuse the knife or as it ages especially if you put them in the dishwasher.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far so good
reviews.reviewText: These are great little all purpose knives. Sometimes you just need to cut something and you don't need an expensive chef knife. These fit those purposes perfectly. They are inexpensive so when one of my family takes one in their lunch and doesn't bring it back or someone throws one away, they can easily be replaced. Great product..

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I bought these because they are similar to other paring knives I have bought before. They are very dull I could barely cut through a mini cucumber. I would return them but I no longer have the packaging.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars They are cheap and sharp
reviews.reviewText: I really just wanted a couple of cheap knives for those times when you tell yourself "you shouldnt use a good knife for that" but are too rushed (or lazy) to go look for a utility knife so you use the good knife anyway.They are cheap, and light weight and sharp. They are only beveled on one side so make a terrible paring knife, but great for the aforementioned ugly knife tasks

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I needed this to cut aloe vera meat from the leaf, these knives were perfect for precise cutting. Small but just right for my small hands.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These knives were neither sharp enough to cut through apple skin nor point enough to poke through an avocado. I was trying to replace a Pampered Chef knife, and these were not of like quality. I returned them.

These may look like a little knife but be careful. They are very sharpe and easy to use. They fit in your hand nicely. As for the price you can't beat it for 4 knives. I definitely would buy these again.
Too small and tends to wander when cutting due to being sharpened from one edge.
Way smaller then I had thought they were.
